description.value:
You have a large, magical, hardened orb in your chest that protects your heart and empowers you with magic.
This heart can be used as a spellcasting focus and you can tap into it up to twice to use the following traits.
You regain one usage of Heart of the Sea at the end of a short rest, and two usages at the end of a long rest.

  • Energy Reserves: As a minor action, regain 1 mana.
  • Cardioprotection: As a minor action, gain 5 temporary hit points.
  • Cardiac Conduction: As a reaction, when you need to make a Strength check, you can add +1 to your roll if called out before you are told the result or DC of the check.
  • Speak with Marine Animals: As a minor action, you and marine beasts can speak with and understand each other for 1 hour.
    Their thoughts are often simple and straightforward and are not always helpful, but words often travel fast underwater.
  • Summon Sharks: At 3rd level, you can cast the Phantom Steed (D&D 5th Edition) spell once per long rest to summon a Phantom Shark, listed below.
    You can use your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Presence as your spellcasting attribute when casting spells this way.
    If you are a spellcaster, you can also add this version of this spell to your spell list. It is always prepared and does not count against the spells you can prepare each day.
  • Bubble Bomb: At 5th level, you can cast the @Compendium[undertaking.spells-level-3.7UWC00HNXCOL4GFI]{Fireball} spell once per long rest, even underwater. Wet creatures do not take reduced damage from fire damage dealt by this spell.
    You can use your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Presence as your spellcasting attribute when casting spells this way.
    If you are a spellcaster, you can also add this underwater version of this spell to your spell list. It is always prepared and does not count against the spells you can prepare each day.
